result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Thomas James Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states both matters are resolved and states recs.  State makes clarifications.  Court questions DE on plea in 16CF292.  Atty Tsai states DE pleads NC.  DE pleads NC.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Tsai makes statement re: agreement.

15CF67 - Motion to revoke DPA withdrawn

16CF292
Ct 1:  ***Amended to Misd. Bailjumping - NC
12 months probation
Conditons of probation:
7 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 1/8/2017 at 6:00 pm unless agent direct's otherwise
EMP approved per jail rules
May serve in Juneau Co if accepted
Costs/surcharges of $443.00 to be paid w/in  60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk's Office
DNA sample to be provided
Return date on November 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter reset for three weeks.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Court quashes warrant and sets for RD.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from Clerk of Courts to defendant

No contact w/R.J. or her son L.J.J. except DE may have contact w/L.J.J. if the contact is approved by his agent and the contact is supervised by somone approved by his agent and the contact does not exceed 3 hours twice per week.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Adam Raabe on behalf of Atty Gumz.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe explains reason for motion hearing today.  DE has job now and is set to begin jail sentence 4/8/16 and is now requesting to serve jail sentence in Juneau Co and is also requesting to have contact w/R.J. as he is the father.  State doesn't object to transfer to Juneau Co but at this time she has no information from the victim or their mother so wouldn't object if the mother and the agent approve.  Atty Raabe suggests child exchange plan as the no contact provision would remain in place.  Court grants motion to transfer to Juneau Co jail for jail sentence.  Conditionally grants motion to modify bond so DE may have contact w/the child but it must be supervised and subject to agent approval.  Arrangements for exchange of the child are to be made through the mother of the DE along w/the mother of the child.  DE says there is no official placement addressed in the family file.  Visitation would not exceed three hours for two occasions per week.  Court to prepare an amended bond for the DE to sign.
Motion hearing on March 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chapter 950 has been complied with.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 3:  Dismissed but read in 

Counts 2 & 4:
2 years Probation
10 days SCJ (Count 2 only), w/work release, consecutive.  Commence on or before April 8, 2016 @ 6:30 PM
1 day credit if probation revoked
Undergo any counseling per agent including Domestic Abuse and Anger Management
$543.00 + $443.00  Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered 24 mos. on Ct. 1; Filed agreement today.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing at 02-08-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes there is an agreement for a DPA in this matter.  Atty Gumz is in agreement but notes they are yet awaiting reports from Dr. Birney which he feels will be done by this Thursday.  Requests reset to next Monday.  State agrees to reset.  Court resets.  Bond continued.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
for Dr. Berney for Examination under 971.16

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gumz gives status.  Possible DPA offered.  Agreement not reached as of yet.  Request matter return to jury trial calendar.  Attorney Gumz advises court of medical issues.  Request Not Guilty by reason of mental disease/defect.  State was just made aware of the change in plea.  Court accepts NGI plea.  Court orders evaluation to be completed.  Attorney Gumz suggests Dr. Kent Berney.  State is not agreeing to Dr. Berney, however would request the right to name/have a different evaluator at a later date.  Payment of such report to be addressed at a different time.
Cover Letter from Attorney Gumz to Br. 3

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gumz gives status.  Matter not yet resolved.  Medical circumstances at issue.  Motions filed today to adj.  Request matter remain on calendar, however status update at that time.  Bond continues.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE was hospitalized, need reset.  Talked with ADA Hoffman.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial br. 3.  However Atty. Gumz requests a plea/sentencing probably 30 days out.  Bond continues.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Return date on April 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State does not object to reset.  Attorney Gumz gives status.  Medical/mental health issues.  Request 45-60 day reset.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson by video from LEC with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Defendant Thomas James Johnson in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Sacra responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/R.J. or her child L.J.J.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
